State policy to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, coordinate transportation & land use
Accommodate \(80 \%\)of housing, \(60 \%\)of job growth in \(< 5 \%\)of land with transit access
Caltrain corridor is original transit-oriented development
If Caltrain were shut down, it would take 4-5 extra lanes on Highway 101 to carry the extra rush hour traffic.
- Accommodate more people with less cars, traffic, parking demand
- Transit passes, shuttles, carpool, carshare, education/marketing
- Average miles driven by 16 to 34 year-olds dropped by \(23\%\) between 2001 & 2009
- \(75 \%\)of millennials expect to live in a place where they do not need a car to get around
- Caltrain rider average income \(117,000 (could drive if they wanted to)
Better access to jobs in San Francisco
Better access to jobs in San Francisco
Double ridership in the next decade
"We need to double Caltrain ridership from 60,000 to 120,000 daily trips by the next decade"
Carl Guardino, Silicon Valley Leadership Group

Even distribution (are some cars less full)
Current peak - 5 car trains, 5 trains per hour = 25

- Faster acceleration
- More stops in same end to end time

- Serve underserved stations
- Lawrence, Santa Clara

- More frequent service leads to stress at intersections
